France will begin lifting what has been
one of the harshest lock downs in Europe
from Monday most businesses will reopen
and people will be allowed to leave home
without carrying a permit but the
country is being color-coded with some
areas like Paris having to wait longer
than others for restrictions to be
lifted
Lucy Williamson is in Paris for us a
houses going to work well France as you
say is going to be divided into two
color-coded zones red and green here in
Paris and the regions of the north south
and east it's going to be red that's
where the virus is circulating
it's where the hospitals have seen more
than 80 percent of their intensive care
beds filled with coronavirus patients
now on Monday when the lockdown starts
to lift you won't see many big
differences between the two zones
primary schools and shops will open
across the country or at least they'll
start to and people will be able to move
